medium_description_en: Diagnoses familial hypercholesterolemia (FH) based on clinical, genetic and family history.

input_schema.subheading_instructions: If yes, 9+ additional criteria required for Definite FH

input_schema.name: entry
input_schema.label_en: Patient has elevated cholesterol, family history of FH, and/or family history of premature cardiac death

input_schema.name: relative_corvasc
input_schema.tips_en: Male relative <55 years, female relative <60 years
input_schema.label_en: First-degree relative with premature coronary and/or vascular disease

input_schema.name: relative_ldl95
input_schema.label_en: First-degree relative with known LDL >95th percentile for age and sex

input_schema.name: relative_xan
input_schema.label_en: First-degree relative with tendon xanthomata and/or arcus cornealis

input_schema.name: child_ldl95
input_schema.label_en: Children <18 years with known LDL >95th percentile for age and sex

input_schema.name: premvasc
input_schema.label_en: Patient with premature cerebral or peripheral vascular disease

input_schema.name: dna
input_schema.label_en: Functional mutation of LDLR, apoB or PCSK9 gene

how_to_use.use_case_en: Patients with suspected familial hypercholesterolemia (FH), including those with elevated cholesterol and/or family history of premature cardiac events.
how_to_use.pearls_pitfalls_en:
• Assigns points to risk factors and stratifies likelihood of diagnosis into one of four categories: definite, probable, possible, and unlikely.
  • Requires DNA testing for completeness.
how_to_use.why_use_en:
• FH is underdiagnosed and carries significant mortality risk from cardiac events.
  • The European Atherosclerosis Society recommends that the Dutch Criteria be used to diagnose FH.
  • Alternative diagnostic criteria include US MEDPED and the Simon Broome Diagnostic Criteria. The risk factors in each criteria set are similar, and clinical judgment as well as local practice factors (similarity of target population to study population) should be considered.

next_steps.advice_en: Consider lifestyle changes, drug therapy, family testing, and other measures to manage FH if diagnosed.

about.more_info_en:
Score interpretation:

Stratification Total Score
Definite familial hypercholesterolemia >8
Probable familial hypercholesterolemia 6-8
Possible familial hypercholesterolemia 3-5
Unlikely familial hypercholesterolemia <3
about.evidence_based_medicine_en: The Dutch Criteria were constructed by the Dutch Lipid Clinic Network to identify patients with familial hypercholesterolemia based on known risk factors.

creator_info.about_en: Melissa Austin, PhD, MS, is a professor emeritus of epidemiology at the University of Washington. Her research spans many areas including genetic epidemiology of chronic diseases, lipoprotein metabolism and pancreatic cancer.
